title: Sell Bordeaux
metaDescription: Sell your Bordeaux wine collection to Proof Cellars. We buy first growths, classified estates, and Right Bank collectibles. Direct offers.
heroSubhead: We buy Bordeaux directly - from first growths to classified estates.
introParagraph: Bordeaux produces some of the world's most collectible wines. We buy Bordeaux directly, from first growth estates like Lafite, Margaux, and Petrus to classified growths and Right Bank producers. Submit photos and details to receive an offer with no consignment fees.
whatWeBuy: First growths (Lafite, Latour, Margaux, Mouton, Haut-Brion)
Super seconds (Leoville Las Cases, Palmer, Cos d'Estournel)
Classified growths from Left and Right Bank
whatWeDoNotBuy: Wines with visible seepage or heat damage
Bottles with extremely low fill levels
Wines from unknown or poor storage conditions
Items we cannot legally purchase in your state
photoChecklist: Front label showing chateau, vintage, and appellation
Fill level visible in the bottle neck
Any damage, staining, or condition issues
conditionFactors: Fill level must be appropriate for the vintage - high shoulder or better for most wines
Capsule must show no signs of seepage or leakage
Label condition matters - staining and damage reduce value
Storage history is important - provenance documentation adds value
Original wood cases (OWC) add meaningful value
pricingFactors: Current market demand for that producer and vintage

faqs.question: Which Bordeaux chateaux do you buy?
faqs.answer: We buy first growths, super seconds, classified growths, and collectible Right Bank producers. Contact us with your specific wines for evaluation.

faqs.question: Do you buy full cases of Bordeaux?
faqs.answer: Yes. We buy single bottles as well as full cases. Original wood cases (OWC) add value.

faqs.question: How important is vintage quality for Bordeaux?
faqs.answer: Vintage quality significantly affects value. Great vintages from top chateaux command premium prices.

faqs.question: What fill levels are acceptable?
faqs.answer: For younger wines, into neck is expected. Older wines may show some ullage. High shoulder or better is generally acceptable for mature vintages.

faqs.question: Does the original wood case add value?
faqs.answer: Yes. Original wood cases add value, especially for first growths and collectible estates.

faqs.question: How quickly will I receive an offer?
faqs.answer: We typically respond within one business day. Larger cellars may take slightly longer to evaluate.

faqs.question: Do you buy Sauternes?
faqs.answer: Yes. We buy collectible Sauternes including Chateau d'Yquem and other premier estates.

faqs.question: What is provenance and why does it matter?
faqs.answer: Provenance documents the wine's ownership and storage history. Proper storage in temperature-controlled conditions adds confidence and value.
